contentrichtext.text: The '''Battle of Aldenhoven''', a [[France|French]] victory, was fought on 2 October 1794. The French general, [[Jean-Baptiste Jourdan]], opposed an [[Austria]]n army under General [[FranÃ§ois Sebastien Charles Joseph de Croix, Count of Clerfayt|Clairfayt]]. The battle took place near the town of [[Aldenhoven]], twenty kilometres northeast of [[Aachen]], in present-day [[Germany]]. ==References== {{unreferenced|date=September 2007}} {{France-battle-stub}} {{Austria-battle-stub}} {{coord missing|North Rhine-Westphalia}} [[Category:Conflicts in 1794]] [[Category:Battles of the French Revolutionary Wars|Aldenhoven 1794]] [[Category:Battles involving Austria|Aldenhoven 1794]] [[Category:1794 in Austria]] [[Category:1794 in France]] [[Category:History of the Rhineland]]
